title: Course introduction
text:
What is statistics?

The science of collecting, analyzing, presenting, and interpreting data.

title: Course introduction
text:
Airline travelers‚Äô club

An airline offers an executive club and claim that 10% of its customers would qualify for the membership.
You suspect it is actually less than 10%.
You randomly selected 1000 customers, and found 91 of them would qualify.
Is the airline‚Äôs premise correct?

Food pantry
The pantry exists to support individuals on their journey as they work toward achieving their goals. We are committed to increasing access to food as a key to success, by assisting any student in need! If you need access or have questions, please contact the Office of Student Life by phone at 313-593-5390, by email at umdearbornpantry@umich.edu.

title: Population, sample, and variable
text:
Population

Definition: A collection of objects of interest in a study
Studying who will win an upcoming mayoral election

Population: Everyone who are planning to vote

Studying the defect rate of a cellphone screen from a manufacturer

Population: All the cellphone screens made by the manufacturer

title: Population, sample, and variable
text:
Sample

Definition: A subset of the population selected by a defined procedure
Studying who will win an upcoming mayoral election

Sample: An telephone poll of 500 randomly selected potential voters

Studying the defect rate of a cellphone screen from a manufacturer

Sample: 200 randomly selected screens for inspection

title: Population, sample, and variable
text:
Variable

Definition: A characteristic of interest for the elements
Houses

size, # of bedrooms, year built, school district, ‚Ä¶

Patients

age, weight, blood sugar level, ‚Ä¶

Universities

tuition, enrollment, graduation rate, ‚Ä¶

title: Population, sample, and variable
text:
Discrete variables
The variable takes finite or countably infinite values.

Toss a coin four times, the number of heads you get
The attendance to a basketball game
The number of orders that an online shop receives in a day

title: Population, sample, and variable
text:
Continuous variables
The variable takes infinitely many, uncountable values.

The water level of dam
The speed of riding a bicycle
The time when an order arrives at a shop


If it can take on two particular real values, it can also take on all real values between them.



If you can count it, it is discrete.
If you need to measure it, it is continuous.

title: Population, sample, and variable
text:
Univariate vs.¬†multivariate
Univariate: A single variable

Battery life of a cellphone model
Blood sugar level of diabetic patients


This course focuses mostly on a single variable (except for Chapter 5. Joint Distributions).

title: Population, sample, and variable
text:
Multivariate
Studying the relationship among two or more variables

title: Four levels of measurement
text: Four levels of measurement

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Why do we care?
The level dictates what we can do with the data.

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Nominal (or categorical) data
When numbers are not numbers

They act like names or labels.
Can not be put into order.


Examples

Country code: 1 (USA), 44 (UK), 81 (Japan), ‚Ä¶
Social security numbers
Your UMID
Marital status: single, married, divorced, ‚Ä¶

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Tokyo Olympics men‚Äôs marathon

What information are nominal data?

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Nominal (or categorical) data
Implications

They can not be compared (e.g., \(>, <\))
We can not carry out any calculations (\(+,  ‚àí,  √ó, \div\))
The only math operations that can be done are \(=, \neq\)

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Ordinal data
When numbers are almost numbers

They go into order.
But that‚Äôs about it.
They don‚Äôt tell us about the distance between two numbers.
Airline cabin classes

1: first class, 2: business, 3: premium economy, 4: economy

Hotel ratings (1-5 stars)

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Tokyo Olympics men‚Äôs marathon

What information are ordinal data?

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Ordinal data
Implications

Ordinal numbers can be compared (e.g., \(>,  <\))
However, we can not carry out calculations for differences or magnitudes (\(‚àí, \div\))

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Interval & ratio data
When numbers are really numbers

Not only can be put to order
The distance between them tell us something.
Tom drinks 3 cups of coffee. Kate drinks 1 cup.

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Ratio data
Ratio data have a genuine1, non-arbitrary zero point.

I have zero dollars.

absence of money

I walk at a speed of 0 mph

no movement


A ‚Äúgenuine‚Äù zero means there is none of the thing being measured.

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Examples of ratio data

Length (100 meters)
Weight (50 lbs)
Size (800 square feet)
Speed (20 mph)
Time duration (5 hours)


The majority of scientific measures are ratio measures.

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Interval data
Interval data have an arbitrary zero point.
Zero does not mean there is none of the things being measured.

What is the temperature for 0¬∞C?

0¬∞C does not mean there is no warmth.

Calendar year 2025. What does year 0 mean?

Year 0 does not mean it‚Äôs the beginning of time.

What is longitude (geographic coordinate) of 0¬∞?

Prime meridian

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Examples of interval data

Temperature in Fahrenheit (70¬∞F) or Celsius (20¬∞C)
Calendar year
GPS coordinates (42.3185, -83.2327)
GPS heading (90¬∞)

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Implications without a genuine zero
We can talk about ratios with ratio measures (duh!)

Tom drinks ‚òï‚òï‚òï. Kate drinks ‚òï.

Tom drink ‚òï‚òï more coffee than Kate.
Tom drink 3 times as much coffee as Kate.

Today is 40¬∞F. Yesterday was 20¬∞F.

Today is 20¬∞F warmer than yesterday.
The average temp of the two days is 30¬∞F.
Today is twice as warm as yesterday.

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Implications without a genuine zero

With interval data

we can calculate the difference (\(-\)).
we can not calculate the ratio (\(\div\)).

With ratio data we can carry out most calculations.

title: Four levels of measurement
text:
Tokyo Olympics men‚Äôs marathon

What information are ratio data?

title: Four levels of measurement
text: Qualitative and quantitative data
